result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MARCUS A CAPPERT

records.addlTxt: No violent contact with V1 in Winneconne PD report 22-133. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. No contact with V1's residence. DE to participate in Mental Health evaluations recommended by crisis. Remain at the crisis center until they recommend his discharge. Take all psychotropic meds & psychotropic RX as prescribed. Absolute sobriety. No alcohol consumption or possession. No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. No use of Delta 8.

2:38 PM Defendant MARCUS A CAPPERT appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer & Kou Thao appeared by video for MARCUS A CAPPERT.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties. Advised of rights. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Victim addresses the court. Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Record closed @ 257
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
